item.title: Data for Impact: South-South Cooperation in Action
item.description: On September 12, the International Day for South-South Cooperation, we celebrate how countries across the Global South are working together to solve shared development challenges.

item.title: Can private management of African protected areas improve socioeconomic and wildlife outcomes?
item.description: African governments increasingly entrust the management of protected areas to private, nongovernmental organizations, with the hope that the significant resources and technical capacities of private organizations will help realize the potential of these areas.

item.title: Understanding Socioeconomic Disparities in Mobility Behavior During the COVID-19 Pandemic in Developing Countries
item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic profoundly disrupted global mobility, but how did it affect different socioeconomic groups, particularly in developing and middle-income countries?

item.title: Examining the Impact of Social Distancing on Household-Level Economic Performances in Vietnam
item.description: During the COVID-19 pandemic, governments implemented social distancing measures to curb the spread of the virus. However, these measures also impacted peopleâ€™s socioeconomic well-being.

item.title: Understanding Informal Trade Dynamics in Benin
item.description: Benin’s trade performance has been improving gradually in the past decade. Notably, informal trade, smuggling and small-scale cross border trade (SSCBT) are part of the large unrecorded trade dynamics in this African country.

item.title: Assessing Social Inequality and Lockdown Policies using Mobile Location Data in Indonesia
item.description: Challenge Lockdown policies such as stay-at-home orders and non-essential business closures are central to fighting the novel coronavirus. However, policy makers are having a hard time answering key questions about their efficacy.
